alert.note: Alert for Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 22 at 7:57PM EST until December 24 at 1:45AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Southampton County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Peters Bridge boat landing and portions of the Chub Sandhill Natural Area Preserve are flooded, approximately 5 miles upstream of gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Friday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river level is expected to be nearly steady, cresting this evening. The river level will then begin to fall, dropping below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 10.3 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 02/28/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 800 AM EST.
